abstract: The Pacific Investment Management Company has been hired to advise the U.S. government on the value of $118 billion of assets guaranteed in the bailout of Bank of America, Bloomberg News reported, citing two people with knowledge of the decision.
lead_paragraph: The Pacific Investment Management Company has been hired to advise the U.S. government on the value of $118 billion of assets guaranteed in the bailout of Bank of America, Bloomberg News reported, citing two people with knowledge of the decision.

headline.main: Pimco Advising U.S. Government on BofA, Report Says

abstract: Kenneth D. Lewis, the chief executive of Bank of America, said Monday that the bank made a “tactical mistake” in requesting $20 billion in government aid to bolster its acquisition of Merrill Lynch.
lead_paragraph: Kenneth D. Lewis, the chief executive of Bank of America, said Monday that the bank made a “tactical mistake” in requesting $20 billion in government aid to bolster its acquisition of Merrill Lynch.

headline.main: Lewis Says He Regrets Size of Merrill Aid
